content:
• Wednesday, November 22, 2017
  • NRIFF

    Nuvo Pharmaceuticals wraps succession plan with new CEO

    • Canada's Nuvo Pharmaceuticals (OTCQX:NRIFF) has named Jesse Ledger its new chief executive officer.
    • Ledger has been the company's president and will keep that role; he succeeds John London, who will become executive chairman and remain on the board.
    • Chairman Dan Chicoine will stay on the board as well. The moves wrap a CEO succession plan the company adopted last year.
    • "My goal is to make Nuvo a growth oriented pharmaceutical company through the expansion and diversification of our proprietary-product portfolio and the continued global expansion of our Pennsaid 2% business," Ledger says.
    • Shares rose 5.6% during regular trading today.
     
     
     
     
    | 6:27 PM

  • After Hours Gainers / Losers

    • Top gainers: SD +6.3%. UEPS +3.5%. ENIC +3.3%. XNET +2.7%. VERI +2.3%.
    • Top losers: TXMD -2.2%. CCE-OLD -1.6%. RCL -1.5%ACRX -1.2%. ASND -1.1%.
     
     
     
     
    | 5:36 PM
  • BLMN

    Bloomin' Brands retrenches as BofA cuts to Neutral

    • Bloomin' Brands (NASDAQ:BLMN) shares had their worst day in months, down 3.4%, as Bank of America heads to the sideline and trims its price target after a run that includes a Monday spike.
    • Shares have gained 16% since Jana Partners disclosed an 8.74% stake and says it will push for reviewing strategic options, but that complicates the visibility into another activist investment, says analyst Gregory Francfort in his downgrade to Neutral.
    • Barington Capital also recently announced a stake, and Francfort expects a focus on G&A expenses and margin structure: “The upside risk of a more aggressive cost focus drives our Neutral rating."
    • He's lowered his price target to $21, implying just 4.4% upside from today's close.
     
     
     
     
    | 5:14 PM
  • SD

    Icahn takes 13.5% stake in SandRidge Energy, opposes Bonanza Creek buy

    • SandRidge Energy (NYSE:SD) +6.7% after-hours as Carl Icahn discloses a new 13.5% activist stake in the company and says he will vote against the planned acquisition of Bonanza Creek Energy (NYSE:BCEI).
    • The stake makes Icahn SD's biggest shareholder, and he joins other top investors including Fir Tree Partners in believing the BCEI deal is "nonsensical."
    • Icahn had been buying SD shares in October on the belief they were cheap but added millions more shares after the BCEI purchase news, WSJ reports.
     
     
     
     
    | 5:10 PM | 11 Comments
  • UNIT

    In new filing, Aurelius challenges Windstream debt exchange

    • Hedge fund Aurelius is challenging a debt exchange run by Windstream Holdings (WIN +5.5%), saying the exchange offer violates the company's bond indentures.
    • Aurelius had previously alleged default by Windstream on bonds tied to the company's spin-off of Communications Sales & Leasing, now Uniti Group (UNIT +2.3%). Windstream denied that a default had taken place and launched the exchanges of $2.8B in bonds, in order to waive any defaults that Aurelius alleged.
    • Now Aurelius has filed in U.S. District Court challenging the exchange, saying that Windstream has gotten consents waiving the default from less than 30% of bondholders.
    • After a number of extensions to Windstream's exchange offers, the deadline now sits at Nov. 27.
    • Aurelius claims Windstream is trying to "manufacture the necessary majority" to waive the defaults, while Windstream says Aurelius is trying to "manufacture this alleged default ... in order to collect a credit default swap payoff."
    • Previously: Windstream stretches exchange offers another day; shares -5% (Nov. 15 2017)
    • Previously: Windstream -3.9% after revenues fall just short (Nov. 09 2017)
    • Previously: Moody's gives Uniti Group negative outlook on Windstream ties (Nov. 03 2017)
     
     
     
     
    | 3:59 PM | 137 Comments
  • QCOM

    Qualcomm +1.7% on report Broadcom may add stock to bid

    • Qualcomm (NASDAQ:QCOM) is on the move again, jumping 1.7% in the past few minutes, after a Reuters report that Broadcom (AVGO -0.4%) is considering sweetening its takeover offer.
    • After consulting with top Qualcomm shareholders, Broadcom would offer more of its own stock in a new bid, sources told the news service.
    • That indicates more likely pressure on Qualcomm to negotiate with Broadcom, whose chief Hock Tan has said he's open to hostile pursuit. Broadcom is said to be preparing a slate of directors for Qualcomm by that company's Dec. 8 nomination deadline.
     
     
     
     
    | 3:36 PM | 74 Comments
  • CAT

    ITC investigating potential violations of Caterpillar patents

    • The U.S. International Trade Commission says it’s investigating Wirtgen GmbH and Joseph Voegele AG for potential infringements on Caterpillar (NYSE:CAT) patents.
    • Relevant patents could include road construction, milling, and paving machines.   
    • Caterpillar shares are up 0.25%.    
     
     
     
     
    | 3:35 PM | 5 Comments
  • VIPS

    CCB cuts Vipshop to Neutral, trims price target

    • Hong Kong's CCB International Capital has cut its rating on Vipshop Holdings (VIPS +3.7%) ADRs to Neutral from a previous Outperform.
    • It's also cut its price target to $8.92, implying 4.7% upside from here.
    • It's expecting Q4 revenues of $3.45B-$3.6B, below consensus estimates.
    • The company beat revenue expectations with Q3 results on Monday.
     
     
     
     
    | 3:23 PM | 6 Comments
  • AMZN

    Adobe Analytics: Online holiday shopping could reach $107B

    • Holiday shoppers could generate $107B in online sales this season, up 14% on the year, according to Adobe Analytics.
    • Adobe expects Cyber Monday to hit a historic $6.6B in sales. 
    • Related: Amazon (AMZN +1.5%), eBay (EBAY +0.2%), and the SPDR S&P Retail index (XRT +0.5%).  
     
     
     
     
    | 3:21 PM | 13 Comments
  • XNET

    Xunlei +5.6% after Bloomberg calls it "hottest stock" in Nasdaq

    • Xunlei (NASDAQ:XNET) shares are up 5.6% after a Bloomberg feature calling the company “the hottest stock in the Nasdaq Composite Index.”
    • Bloomberg cites the over 350% ADR rally after Xunlei launched its “Wanke coin mining” cryptocurrency project. 
    • While analysts warn that the rally could soon end, Xunlei VP of marketing Dong Xue says the company hopes “investors flock to us because of the future of ‘shared computing’” and the new management team rather than speculation.    
     
     
     
     
    | 3:10 PM | 17 Comments
  • CPB

    Analysts weigh in on Campbell Soup's dismal quarter, near-term outlook

    • Campbell Soup (CPB +1.5%) recoups a bit of yesterday's 8% plunge that followed disappointing FQ1 earnings and a warning that harvest delays of its carrot crop in California due to bad weather likely would hurt results in the current quarter.
    • CPB said it expects delays to pick up in December and that transport disruptions have led to higher supply chain costs.
    • UBS analysts trim their CPB price target by $1 to $41, not seeing a probable near-term path for the company to achieve its 5%-7% EPS growth goal due to volume challenges, pricing pressure and reinvestment needs.
    • RBC cuts its target to $53 from $55, as it continues to expect sequentially higher sales and gross profit in H2 but soup inventory reductions at Wal-Mart, unexpected carrot yield issues and lingering logistics costs likely will prove too difficult to fully offset.
    • J.P. Morgan's Ken Goldman, who rates shares at Neutral, asks if CPB will retain its promotions with a key customer and “if so, to what degree could it help fiscal 2018?” Not much, according to Goldman.
     
     
     
     
    | 2:58 PM | 1 Comment

  • Technology - Top Gainers / Losers as of 2:55 pm

    Frequency Electronics appoints largest shareholder to board

    • Frequency Electronics (NASDAQ:FEIM) announces appointing Jonathan Brolin to its board
    • Brolin, the managing partner of Edenbrook Capital, holds a 14.3% stake in Frequency and is the largest shareholder.
    • Brolin will serve on the board’s Compensation and Audit committees.   
    • Frequency shares are up 0.82%.   
     
     
     
     
    | 2:46 PM
  • NTNX

    Needham initiates Nutanix at Buy

    • Needham initiates Nutanix (NASDAQ:NTNX) with a Buy rating and $45 price target.
    • The firm says Nutanix has a disruptive product and sees long-term upsides if investors shift how they view the company. 
    • Needham says investors currently see Nutanix as a commodity hardware player but could shift to view it as a pure-play software player. 
    • Nutanix shares are up 10.3%.  
     
     
     
     
    | 2:38 PM | 12 Comments
  • CPRT

    Copart +12% for best day in nine years after FQ1 earnings beat

    • Copart (CPRT +11.7%) climbs to a new 52-week high amid its strongest trading day in nine years, after the company easily beat estimates for FQ1 earnings and revenues.
    • Operating results were strong even though Hurricane Harvey added $35.8M in abnormal costs.
    • CPRT's quarterly service revenue jumped 21.8% Y/Y to $374M and vehicle sales revenue rose 15.8% to $45M.
     
     
     
     
    | 2:28 PM
  • ELTK

    Eltek +47.5% due to reverse stock split

    • Eltek (NASDAQ:ELTK) shares are up 47.5% as the previously announced 1-for-5 stock split becomes effective.
    • There were about 10.1M outstanding ordinary shares on November 15 and approximately 2M outstanding after the split.    
     
     
     
     
    | 2:17 PM
  • APO

    Reuters: Apollo Global could buy Qdoba for $300M

    • Private equity firm Apollo Global Management (NYSE:APO) could soon buy Qdoba from parent company Jack in the Box (NASDAQ:JACK), according to Reuters sources.
    • The deal could come as early as next week and total more than $300M.
    • Jack in the Box bought Qdoba in 2003 for $45M but earlier this year said the chain didn’t fit with the rest of Jack’s portfolio. 
    • Apollo Global shares are up 1.13%.
    • Jack in the Box shares are up 0.19%.  
    • Previously: Jack In The Box declares $0.40 dividend (Nov. 20)
     
     
     
     
    | 2:05 PM | 5 Comments

  • Energy/Materials - Top Gainers / Losers as of 2:00 pm

  • IRBT

    iRobot -8% on reports of steeper Roomba discounts

    • iRobot (NASDAQ:IRBT) plunges, apparently on news that the company is running a special this week for $100 off regular prices on four Roomba models compared to two models that saw the same discount last year.
    • A USA Today article on the best Black Friday deals, the iRobot Roomba 690 WiFi-Enabled Robot Vacuum is marked down $100 to $274.99, "the lowest price we've ever seen."
     
     
     
     
    | 1:09 PM | 10 Comments
  • MAT

    Now's the time for Hasbro-Mattel merger, analyst says

    • This is the right time for a merger between Mattel (MAT +1.9%) and Hasbro (HAS), Wells Fargo says, as "while MAT’s turnaround plan is credible and supported by multiple key external hires... the ball is firmly in Hasbro’s court should management want to pursue a deal."
    • Analyst Tim Condor cites conversations with investors in speculating that a $25/share offer for MAT likely would secure a deal, adding that an offer in January “makes the most sense as it would provide HAS visibility on Christmas.”
    • Wells maintains an Outperform rating on MAT with a $19 price target and a Market Perform rating on HAS with a $95 target.
     
     
     
     
    | 12:56 PM | 15 Comments

  • Midday Gainers / Losers

    • Gainers: CLNT +100%. ELTK +64%. MARK +27%. NXTD +24%. AMPE +23%. SRAX +22%. RIOT +21%. MARA +18%. ITI +17%. OVID +16%.
    • Losers: PN -60%. CHFS -43%. ICON -19%. EKSO -16%. BZUN -15%. QD -14%. COLL -13%. GES -12%. NVLN -10%. BBOX -10%.

  • PN

    Patriot National -60% on forbearance agreement

    • Patriot National (PN -64.1%) plunges by more than 60% after disclosing it has entered into a forbearance agreement with its lenders, and that much of its revenue and cash flow will cease.
    • PN is in default of its credit Agreement due to the failure to deliver timely financial statements, non-payment of interest due Nov. 1 and the failure to comply with financial covenants.
    • Based on the company's deteriorating financial condition, PN says it is terminating ~250 employees, or one-third of its workforce.
     
     
     
     
    | 12:32 PM | 3 Comments
  • FRO

    Frontline says crude tanker industry too fragmented

    • Frontline (FRO -1.9%) is lower after posting a larger than expected Q3 net loss as tanker rates hit four-hit lows during the quarter.
    • CEO Robert Hvide Macleod says FRO expects the global market for crude oil tankers to remain weak until H2 2018, and believes the market for crude carriers remains too fragmented and needs consolidation.
    • But the company says more than 20% of the global fleet of very large crude carriers could be sent to scrap yards in coming years as their age and inefficient fuel consumption make them obsolete.
    • Also, the rise in crude oil prices is "a real sign that demand for oil is strong, we can have confidence in demand growing,” Macleod says. "We will be very well positioned when the market recovers."
     
     
     
     
    | 12:21 PM | 1 Comment

  • YNDX

    Yandex adds chief operating officer role for CFO Abovsky

    • Yandex (YNDX -1.7%) has named a new chief operating officer, after its current COO has decided to leave the company, it says.
    • Greg Abovsky is the new chief, effective Dec. 1; he replaces Alexander Shulgin. Abovsky will continue acting as chief financial officer, while Arkady Volozh will remain chief executive.
    • Abovsky had joined the company as VP of Investor Relations and Corporate Development in 2013.
     
     
     
     
    | 11:59 AM
  • QADA

    QAD -2.9% despite Q3 beat, upside guidance

    • QAD (NASDAQ:QADA) shares are down 2.9% after reporting Q3 results that beat revenue estimates and met on EPS.
    • Upside FY18 guidance was raised to revenue of $300M to $302M (consensus: $294.63M; was $292M to $296M). 
    • Revenue breakdown: Subscription, $17.2M (+$3.5M Y/Y); License, $6.6M ($2.3M); Professional services, $20.7M (+$0.3M); Maintenance and other, $32.4M (-$0.2M).    
    • Press release    
    • Previously: QAD EPS in-line, beats on revenue (Nov. 21)
     
     
     
     
    | 11:43 AM
  • CERN

    Cerner +4.9% on word of large Amazon cloud deal coming

    • Shares in Cerner (NASDAQ:CERN) have spiked 4.9% after a CNBC report says Amazon.com (AMZN +0.8%) is set to announce a huge cloud deal with the healthcare tech provider.
    • Amazon Web Services and Cerner will announce a deep team-up at AWS re:Invent next week, to be announced by AWS CEO Andy Jassy, according to the report.
    • The two will work together on helping providers use data to make health predictions about patient populations.
    • The deal's said to focus first on Cerner's "population health" product HealtheIntent.
     
     
     
     
    | 11:33 AM | 28 Comments

  • PYPL

    German court rules on PayPal purchase protection

    • The German high court decides on cases involving PayPal’s (NASDAQ:PYPL) purchase protection arrangement, which provides customers with a refund if the item isn’t right or never arrives.
    • The court says sellers can still sue buyers for nonpayment on items refunded under the protection because the agreement doesn’t change the contractual rights existing between the seller and buyer. 
    • PayPal shares are down 1.03%.       
    • Previously: PayPal hooks up with micro-investing app (Nov. 20)
     
     
     
     
    | 11:12 AM | 12 Comments
  • EC

    Ecopetrol eyes $3.5B-$4B in investments next year

    • Ecopetrol (EC +2.4%) says it plans capital spending of $3.5B-$4B in 2018, 35%-55% above this year's amount, and expects to post a net profit assuming Brent crude prices of $35/bbl.
    • The state-run Colombian company says in a filing that it expects to produce 715K-725K bbl/day next year, after 2017 output is expected to total ~715K bbl/day.
    • EC says it expects to spend 85% of its 2018 investment on E&P, including at least 12 exploratory wells, and forecasts refineries in Cartagena and Barrancabermeja processing 350K-375K bbl/day next year.
     
     
     
     
    | 10:41 AM
  • SGMS

    Scientific Games acquires shares of NYX Gaming

    • Scientific Games (NASDAQ:SGMS) announces acquiring 11.6M ordinary shares of NYX Gaming Group.
    • Shares were purchased through the TSX Venture Exchange and priced between CAD$2.22 and CAD$2.35. 
    • Aggregate purchase price was CAD$27.1M. 
    • Scientific Games will continue to pursue its acquisition of NYX Gaming. 
    • Scientific Games shares are down 0.38%.  
     
     
     
     
    | 10:40 AM

  • Crude futures pares gains post inventory data

  • BT

    BT Group +2.7% as EE wins appeal over annual license fees

    • BT Group (NYSE:BT) is up 2.7% premarket after its mobile unit EE won an appeal over radio band license fee increases.
    • The UK may have to give £300M back to mobile phone companies after losing the appeal over ALF.
    • That followed a decision by regulator Ofcom to triple the license fees that firms pay, prompting angry protests from the operators.
    • But the Court of Appeal has ruled the government has no legal power to compel Ofcom to raise the fees.
     
     
     
     
    | 9:29 AM

    Baozun -4.6% after Q3 beats, in-line guidance

    • Baozun (NASDAQ:BZUN) share are down 4.6% premarket despite Q3 results that beat EPS and revenue estimates.

  • RLOG

    Rand Logistics -31% on restructuring deal

    • Rand Logistics (NASDAQ:RLOG) -31.3% premarket after agreeing to be acquired by P-E firm American Industrial Partners.
    • Under the terms of the agreement with AIP affiliate Lightship Capital, AIP will convert all of RLOG's second lien debt into 100% of the new common equity of a reorganized company.
    • RLOG says the deal will eliminate $90M in outstanding debt and dramatically reduce annual interest expense.

  • SEII

    Cleantech +124% on share swap deal with Integrated Media

    • Cleantech Solutions (CLNT) +124.7% premarket on news that its Vantage Ultimate subsidiary entered into a conditional share swap deal to buy a 51% stake in the issued share capital of Integrated Media Technology Ltd.
    • CLNT cites Integrated Media founder and CEO Herbert Ying Chiu Lee's "extensive experience in technology research and development management, particularly in knowledge management systems and 3D autostereoscopic displays."
     
     
     
     
    | 8:51 AM | 5 Comments
  • EXEL

    Exelixis announces Phase 3 CELESTIAL trial results of Cabozantinib in previously treated advanced Hepatocellular Carcinoma

    • Exelixis (NASDAQ:EXEL) announces that the phase 3 CELESTIAL trial results have been accepted as a late-breaking presentation at the 2018 American Society of Clinical Oncology’s Gastrointestinal Cancers Symposium (ASCO-GI), which is being held January 18–20, 2018 in San Francisco.
    • CELESTIAL is a randomized, double-blind, placebo-controlled study of cabozantinib in patients with advanced HCC. The trial was designed to enroll 760 patients with advanced HCC who received prior sorafenib and may have received up to two prior systemic cancer therapies for HCC and had adequate liver function.
    • Based on available data from various published trials conducted in the second-line setting of advanced HCC, the CELESTIAL trial statistics for the primary endpoint of overall survival (OS) assumed a median OS of 8.2 months for the placebo arm. A total of 621 events provide the study with 90% power to detect a 32% increase in median OS at the final analysis. Two interim analyses were planned and conducted at 50% and 75% of the planned 621 events.
    • CABOMETYX tablets are approved in the U.S. for the treatment of patients with advanced RCC who have received prior anti-angiogenic therapy.
    • Shares are up 2% premarket on light volume.
     
     
     
     
    | 8:45 AM
  • GME

    GameStop up 4.9% post-earnings; Benchmark definitely not a buyer

    • via Notable Calls
    • "In our view, the Company’s management team has destroyed value and their diversification strategy has failed," says an unimpressed Benchmark. "We expect digital pressure to be ongoing, offering limited terminal value."
    • Sales per store are down year-over-year for 12 straight quarters, says the team, which also notes user margin plunging to 43.6%, the lowest in a decade.
    • Benchmark cuts its price target to $15.
    • GME +4.9% to $17.55.
    • Previously: GameStop +3.4% as another gain in same-store sales drives Q3 beat (Nov. 21)
    • Previously: GameStop beats by $0.11, beats on revenue (Nov. 21)
     
     
     
     
    | 8:17 AM | 26 Comments
  • SSNNF

    Samsung tops Q3 smartphone panel market

    • Samsung (OTC:SSNNF, OTC:SSNLF) topped the smartphone panel market in Q3 with 106M units shipped, according to data from Chinese firm Sigmaintell.
    • Samsung’s shipments grew 6% on the year. 
    • Second and third place belonged to BOE Technology (83M units; +6.4%) and Tianma-Microelectronics (55M units; +48%). 
    • LG Display’s (NYSE:LPL) shipments dropped 27.9% to 33M units, which included 1.2M AMOLED panels.  
    • LG Display shares are up 1.32%.
    • Previously: New Samsung AI research center (Nov. 22)
     
     
     
     
    | 8:14 AM
  • PTLA

    Portola Pharmaceuticals provides update on Bevyxxa commercial launch

    • Portola Pharmaceuticals (NASDAQ:PTLA) announces that the FDA has extended the review period for the Company’s Prior Approval Supplement (PAS) for Bevyxxa (betrixaban) to allow the agency time to review the entire submission.
    • The new action date is January 30, 2018 and commercial launch is anticipated by February 2018.
    • FDA approved Bevyxxa is indicated for the prophylaxis of venous thromboembolism (VTE) in adult patients hospitalized for an acute medical illness who are at risk for thromboembolic complications due to moderate or severe restricted mobility and other risk factors for VTE.
    • Shares are down 2% premarket on light volume.
     
     
     
     
    | 8:13 AM | 3 Comments

  • Cable turns lower as U.K. government slashes growth outlook

    • In his budget presentation before parliament, Chancellor Philip Hammond says the government expects just 1.4% GDP growth next year vs. 1.6% previously guessed at. 2019 is now seen at 1.3% vs. 1.7% previously, and 2020 at 1.3% vs. 1.9%. Just for laughs, the government tosses out a 2021 estimate of 1.5% vs. 2.0% previously.
    • 2017 GDP growth is now expected to be 1.5% vs. 2% previously.
    • Punters are selling sterling (NYSEARCA:FXB) following the news. Higher earlier in the session, the British unit is now down 0.1%.
    • The FTSE 100 is ahead 0.5%.
    • ETFs: FXB, EWU, GBB, DBUK, FKU, EWUS, DXPS, HEWU, QGBR
     
     
     
     
    | 8:09 AM
  • DE

    Deere beats by $0.10, beats on revenue

    • Deere (NYSE:DE): Q4 EPS of $1.57 beats by $0.10.
    • Revenue of $7.09B (+25.5% Y/Y) beats by $100M.
    • Shares +4.1% PM.
    • Press Release
     
     
     
     
    | 6:47 AM | 10 Comments
